text:
Champions League
OL - Benfica: "Leo Dubois will be the captain tomorrow"
On the eve of the match of the fourth day of the Champions League against Benfica, OL coach Rudi Garcia announced that Leo Dubois will inherit the armband.
04 Nov 2019, 17:30 by Charlie Creteur



Rudi Garcia continues his turn-over for the captain's armband! While waiting for his final decision on the captaincy, the new coach of Olympique Lyonnais has already given the armband to Marcelo, Depay, Lopes and Denayer. For the match of the fourth day of the Champions League against Benfica, the former resident of Olympique Marseille has unveiled the name of his fifth captain in five matches since his induction. "Leo Dubois will be captain tomorrow," he said.








Rudi Garcia protects Marcelo




Marcelo + 11 üì∑Credit Photo - Icon Sport

The OM coach also posted his ambitions, get the 3 points and generally qualify for the round of 16. He was also questioned about the Marcelo affair. The Brazilian, criticized by supporters after being defeated against supporters of Kop Virage Nord (KVN) after the defeat against Benfica. "Juninho and the president have taken up the problem, I'm focusing on the game tomorrow," retorted the coach. "I make my choices according to the athlete, trying to always have the best team in the field, there is only that dictates my choices."
